comments:
build 2002-04-18 on WinXP.

I got a bunch of these in my log when stepping over a method call. I had been 
debugging, had hit my breakpoint and went "into" a couple of times, browsed 
some variable values, and then hit "over" and got these in the log.

Yikes. JDWP error code 34 states "The variable is not an appropriate type for 
the function used." But looking at the java doc, it is not clear how this can 
happen. Leaving open for now - "hoping" for a reproduceable test case.

This seems to happen every time in my current workspace (I have shutdown and 
come back in again). Will zip up workspace and send instruction and more 
detail.

I was able to reproduce the problem. It appears to be a VM bug, as the problem 
occurrs with IBM1.3.0 but not Sun's 1.3.1_01 VM. We are attepmting to retrieve 
the value of the local "e" which is the IOException caught when 
closing "input". It works in the first try/catch/finally block, and then causes 
a problem in the second try/catch/finally block. However, there are no bad side 
effects other than the variable displays as "<not responding>" in the UI. We 
simply catch the exception (log it) and keep going. The debugger recovers OK.

Do not intend to fix, but we should report the bug to IBM.
